meanings.definition: Make unable to perform a certain action or function.
meanings.sent1: The injury was so severe that it was incapacitating him from walking.
meanings.sent2: The strong medication was incapacitating her ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The silly hat he wore was so big that it was incapacitating his vision.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise from the construction site was incapacitating my ability to focus.
meanings.sent5: The intense pain in her leg was incapacitating her from standing up.

meanings.definition: Cause someone to be unable to function normally.
meanings.sent1: The flu was incapacitating him, making it hard to get out of bed.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sleep was incapacitating her ability to think clearly.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie was so entertaining that it was incapacitating his laughter.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news was incapacitating her emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The extreme heat was incapacitating everyone's energy levels.
